page.title: 10HORTICULTURE IN SUTTON
page.content: The Local Nursery At the local nursery,a wide range of plants is grown_from small alpine plants to trees and shrubs. The main outlets for the sale of plants are the local street markets. Many of the plants are imported from other countries_trees and shrubs from Belgium and fuschias,bulbs and seeds from Holland. 26 peple work at the nursery.The majority of the work is carried out by hand although a lot of the hard work has been reduced by the introduction of a potting machine.There is also,in operation,a machine for packaging bulbs.The young plants are brought on in greenhouses then they are put outside to harden off before being sold.The major running expenses at the nursery in our climate is the cost of greenhouse heating.
